proof:
Proof. Let $F \in \Omega_C^{\mathrm{dis}}$. Then $|F| \le \eta|E_C|$, and thus $w_C(F) \le q^{n_C} (e^\beta - 1)^{\eta|E_C|}$. $|\Omega_C^{\mathrm{ord}}| \le 2^{|E_C|}$, and since $F = E_C$ is a configuration, $Z_C \ge q(e^\beta-1)^{|E_C|}$. Whp $|E_C| \le \frac{dn}{2} + \eta n$, hence $|\Omega_C^{\mathrm{ord}}| \le 2^{n(d/2+\eta)}$. Combining the inequalities and using that $\beta \ge \beta_1$,
$$
\frac{Z_C^{\mathrm{ord}}}{Z_C} \le \frac{2^{(d/2+\eta)n}q^{n_C}(e^\beta - 1)^{-(1-\eta)|E_C|}}{q} \le q^{n-(1-\eta)(2-1/10)|E_C|}.
$$
Lemma 39 gives us that whp $|E_C| \ge \frac{dn}{2} - 2ne^{-d/3}$, thus we get that
$$
\frac{Z_C^{\mathrm{ord}}}{Z_C} \le q^{n[1-(1-\eta)(2-1/10)(d/2-2e^{-d/3})/d]} \le q^{-n[1/20-2\eta+5e^{-d/3}/d]}
$$
By the choice of $\eta$, for all $d$ large enough this is at most $q^{-n/40}$. Hence for all $q$ large enough, it is at most $e^{-n}$.
